p.s: yesterday I read an article written by John Worne about the small amount of interested people in learning different languages and one sentence catched me a lot and I want to talk about it.
The quotation is language learning is vital for the UK's future prosperity and global standing.
At first this quotation makes sense to me I thought, that you have to learn different languages to communicate with other people in other countries.
But on the other hand you could say that English is the global language and that everyone has to learn English.
But I think that this is a problem.
For example China: In China they don't learn English like in other countries.
So in some intercultural conversations with China you need to learn Chinese.
But this you could say the other way around: In the UK you don't learn ChineeseChinese so they have to learn English.
I came to the point that English gives you the opportunity to communicate with many countries but not all of them and that learning other languages is definitely not bad.
Please let me know your thoughts about this quotation in the comment section.
I'm looking forward for your answers.
